thread.title: Eagles' Byron Maxwell expects to play vs. Drew Brees, New Orleans Saints
thread.title_full: Eagles' Byron Maxwell expects to play vs. Drew Brees, New Orleans Saints

author: Matt Lombardo | For NJ Advance Media
title: Eagles' Byron Maxwell expects to play vs. Drew Brees, New Orleans Saints
text:
Comments 
PHILADELPHIA -- Facing a must-win situation on Sunday against Drew Brees and the New Orleans Saints, it is all hands on deck time for the Eagles , especially in the secondary. According to cornerback Byron Maxwell, he will be in the lineup against the future Hall of Fame quarterback. 
"I feel good," Maxwell said following Thursday's practice at the NovaCare Complex. "I'll be out there." 
Maxwell departed Sunday's loss to the Washington Redskins at FedEx Field on the first series of the game with a quad contusion and did not return. 
EAGLES VS. SAINTS: Darren Sproles opens up about facing former team for first time 
Surprisingly, opposing quarterbacks have targeted Maxwell. In the three games that he did play this season, Maxwell has surrendered 21 catches for 135 yards and two touchdowns. Albeit Maxwell took his lumps in the season opener against Julio Jones, which has not helped his early season statistics. 
The Eagles signed Maxwell to a $63 million free agent contract this spring, but the secondary did not appear to play any better or worse without the former Seattle Seahawk in the lineup Sunday afternoon. 
Eagles head coach Chip Kelly called Drew Brees 'one of the all-time greats to ever play this game' on Thursday and having Maxwell in the lineup certainly can only help a defense that allowed Kirk Cousins to orchestrate a 90-yard game-winning touchdown drive in Week 4.
